conbody.p: Oxygen XML Author 17 now has quick fixes. Quick fixes can help you quickly check if content adheres the so-called business rules. These are rules for writing and structuring content, much like the rules you can find in style guides.

Quick fixes could work as follows:
Someone (for instance, an Information Architect) writes business rules.For example: "A semicolon cannot be used at the end of a list.“
An XML-specialist turns the business rule into a Schematron pattern.
The technical writers check their content based on this scheme. They can quickly find things that don’t match the business rules and instantly correct them.
